page.title: 04LANDSCAPE-RIVER POWER
page.content: In the past the power of the river was used to grind local seed to flour, Farningham mill produced flour for London bakeries until 1900. The Domesday Book shows there were 2 mills at Eynsford. By Eynsford Ford there is an old white cornmill which is now a tea-shop. It has 3 grindstones in the drive. Last year they pulled down a tall chimney near our school which was part of a paper mill powered by our river. Houses are being built on the site. More people want to live in our villages. Sometimes the river floods, in 1969 it was very bad, it went inside houses and went 22cm. up our church wall. The river brings lots of visitors to our village. People picnic and sunbathe on the grassy banks. Children paddle and do pond dipping. It gets very crowded.
